title: Coming soon: How to use GitHub for collaborative research projects
text: In this second tutorial, we will provide a focused guide on how to use the online platform GitHub for collaborative projects, i.e., to share code, data, and replication material. No previous knowledge required.

title: Intro to R and R Markdown
text:
Please bring your laptops and have R and R Studio installed!
This seminar will be a brief hands-on tutorial on how to get started in R (e.g., by doing a simple regression analysis and some diagnostics) and how to integrate this R code into a R Markdown file for an efficient, all-in-one workflow of writing research papers. Be ready to get your hands dirty!

title: Welcome!
text:
Welcome!
Quantlab is a new network group aiming to bring together social scientists at the University of Melbourne and beyond to share insights in quantitative methods and research.
Co-founders: Seraphine F. Maerz (Political Science) and Irma Mooi-Reci (Sociology).
We are an inclusive network and welcome everyone interested in learning (more) about new quantitative methods and computational techniques. We believe in knowledge sharing and offer learning seminars as well as online tutorials about innovations in data management and analysis, and a platform for project-related code sharing (R, Stata, Python, R Markdown, LaTeX, Quarto).
Come and join us for our bi-weekly QuantLunches, RSVP here!





Schedule for 2024
We meet in Arts West Research Lounge. Lunch is included and kindly sponsored by the School of Social and Political Science.

title: Coming soon: How to use R Markdown to â€˜knitâ€™ nice papers ready for submission in whatever format
text: In this third tutorial, we will provide a focused guide on how to make use of the efficient and coder-friendly workflow in R Markdown and pandoc to produce papers ready for submission in the required formats. No previous knowledge required.
